description: From Middle English fiole, from Old French fiole, from Latin phiala (“a broad, flat, shallow cup or bowl”), from Ancient Greek φιάλη (phiálē). Doublet of vial.

entries.meaning: A glass vessel or bottle, especially a small bottle for medicines.

verbs.description: phial (third-person singular simple present phials, present participle phialling or (US) phialing, simple past and past participle phialled or (US) phialed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To put or keep in, or as in, a phial.
